summary: Project to map button press/release events to GPIO output commands.
architectural_notes: Output command format: `gpioset -c gpiochip0 <button_id>=<state>`; <state>=1 when pressed, 0 when released.

existing_features.title: Change button interaction event emission so that the emitted command string (event.value) uses the format `gpioset -c gpiochip0 #=$`, where `#` is the button's numeric code (1–16) and `$` is `1` when pressed and `0` when released.

Derive the `#` value for the new gpioset command from the existing button code configuration (the button’s 1–16 code) rather than the control's textual layout id, and ensure the command is only emitted when the derived code is valid (1–16).

Update the gpioset command generation utility so it can generate the single-command format `gpioset -c gpiochip0 <id>=<state>` for button press/release, and remove or stop using the old 4-bit-to-multiple-pin mapping generator for button events.

new_feature_requests.summary: Change output signal to use `gpioset -c gpiochip0 <button_id>=<state>` where state is 1 on press and 0 on release.
Update Raspberry Pi bash runner documentation to reflect that button events now emit single `gpioset -c gpiochip0 <id>=<state>` commands on press and release.
